1: I am the man[b] who has experienced[c] affliction from the rod[d] of theLord's wrath.
2: He drove me into captivity[e] and made me walk[f] in darkness and not light.
3: He repeatedly[g] attacks me; he turns his hand[h] against me all day long.[i]
4: He has made my mortal skin[j] waste away; he has broken my bones.
5: He has besieged[k] and surrounded[l] me with bitter hardship.[m]
6: He has made me reside in deepest darkness[n] like those who died long ago.
7: He has walled me in[o] so that I cannot get out; he has weighted me down with heavy prison chains.[p]
8: Also, when I cry out desperately[q] for help,[r] he has shut out my prayer.[s]
9: He has blocked[t] every road I take[u] with a wall of hewn stones; he has made every path impassable.[v]
10: To me he is like a bear lying in ambush,[w] like a hidden lion[x] stalking its prey.[y]
11: He has obstructed my paths[z] and torn me to pieces;[aa] he has made me desolate.
12: He drew[ab] his bow and made me[ac] the target for his arrow.
13: He shot[ad] his arrows[ae] into my heart.[af]
14: I have become the laughingstock of all people,[ag] their mocking song[ah] all day long.[ai]
15: He has given me my fill of bitter herbs and made me drunk with bitterness.[aj]
16: He ground[ak] my teeth in gravel; he trampled[al] me in the dust.
17: I[am] am deprived[an] of peace;[ao] I have forgotten what happiness[ap] is.
18: So I said, “My endurance has expired; I have lost all hope of deliverance[aq] from the Lord.”
19: Remember[ar] my impoverished and homeless condition,[as] which is a bitter poison.[at]
20: I[au] continually think about[av] this, and I[aw] am depressed.[ax]
21: But this I call[ay] to mind;[az] therefore I have hope:
22: The Lord's loyal kindness[ba] never ceases;[bb] his compassions[bc] never end.
23: They are fresh[bd] every morning; your faithfulness is abundant![be]
24: “My portion is the Lord,” I have said to myself,[bf] so I will put my hope in him.
25: The Lord is good to those who trust in[bg] him, to the one[bh] who seeks him.
26: It is good to wait patiently[bi] for deliverance from the Lord.[bj]
27: It is good for a man[bk] to bear[bl] the yoke[bm] while he is young.[bn]
28: Let a person[bo] sit alone in silence, when the Lord[bp] is disciplining him.[bq]
29: Let him bury his face in the dust;[br] perhaps there is hope.
30: Let him offer his cheek to the one who hits him;[bs] let him have his fill of insults.
31: For the Lord[bt] will not reject us forever.[bu]
32: Though he causes us[bv] grief, he then has compassion on us[bw] according to the abundance of his loyal kindness.[bx]
33: For he is not predisposed to afflict[by] or to grieve people.[bz]
34: To crush underfoot all the earth's prisoners,[ca]
35: to deprive a person[cb] of his rights[cc] in the presence of the Most High,
36: to defraud a person in a lawsuit— the Lord[cd] does not approve[ce] of such things!
37: Whose command was ever fulfilled[cf] unless the Lord[cg] decreed it?
38: Is it not from the mouth of the Most High that everything comes— both calamity and blessing?[ch]
39: Why should any living person[ci] complain when punished for his sins?[cj]
40: Let us carefully examine our ways,[ck] and let us return to the Lord.
41: Let us lift up our hearts[cl] and our hands to God in heaven:
42: “We[cm] have blatantly rebelled;[cn] you[co] have not forgiven.”
43: You shrouded yourself[cp] with anger and then pursued us; you killed without mercy.
44: You shrouded yourself with a cloud so that no prayer could get through.
45: You make us like filthy scum[cq] in the estimation[cr] of the nations.
46: All our enemies have gloated over us;[cs]
47: panic and pitfall[ct] have come upon us, devastation and destruction.[cu]
48: Streams[cv] of tears flow from my eyes[cw] because my people[cx] are destroyed.[cy]
49: Tears flow from my eyes[cz] and will not stop; there will be no break[da]
50: until the Lord looks down from heaven and sees what has happened.[db]
51: What my eyes see[dc] grieves me[dd]— all the suffering of the daughters in my city.[de]
52: For no good reason[df] my enemies hunted me down[dg] like a bird.
53: They shut me[dh] up in a pit and threw stones at me.
54: The waters closed over my head; I thought[di] I was about to die.[dj]
55: I have called on your name, O Lord, from the deepest pit.[dk]
56: You heard[dl] my plea:[dm] “Do not close your ears to my cry for relief!”[dn]
57: You came near[do] on the day I called to you; you said,[dp] “Do not fear!”
58: O Lord,[dq] you championed[dr] my cause;[ds] you redeemed my life.
59: You have seen the wrong done to me, O Lord; pronounce judgment on my behalf![dt]
60: You have seen all their vengeance, all their plots against me.[du]
61: You have heard[dv] their taunts, O Lord, all their plots against me.
62: My assailants revile and conspire[dw] against me all day long.
63: Watch them from morning to evening;[dx] I am the object of their mocking songs.
64: Pay them back[dy] what they deserve,[dz] O Lord, according to what they[ea] have done.[eb]
65: Give them a distraught heart;[ec] may your curse be on them!
66: Pursue them[ed] in anger and eradicate them from under the Lord's heaven.
